quest.name: Against the Shadow
journal: Widargelt has urgent tidings for you.

Widargelt informs you that he has received a letter from his former students, D'zentsa and O'tchakha, who bid the two of you come to Dalamud's Talons. Though their agenda is a mystery, Widargelt has questions of his own that he would ask them. Make your way to northern Thanalan and participate in the meeting.

At the meeting, D'zentsa and O'tchakha explain that there exist two aspects of chakra, one each for the sect of light and the sect of shadow; in order to open a chakra of an aspect not his own, a monk must fight a disciple of the opposing sect. To that end, the two Miqo'te attack you and Widargelt, the battle ending with all four combatants experiencing their chakra opening. Having thus accomplished their task, D'zentsa and O'tchakha take their leave, but not before begging you to give up being a monk. Speak with Widargelt to learn his mind on these revelations.

Unsurprisingly, Widargelt has no intention of relinquishing his dreams of rebuilding the Fist of Rhalgr. However, if you are to deal with the threat posed by the sect of shadow, you must learn more about the two aspects of chakra. Professor Erik will soon be arriving at Revenant's Toll to share with you his insights on the subject. Make your way back to the settlement and be present for what will surely prove to be a most enlightening experience.

Professor Erik supplements your knowledge of the history of the Fist of Rhalgr. The order was once formed of two distinct yet united sects─one of light and one of shadow. Alas, the members of the latter were expelled in the wake of a bitter feud over the order's alliance with the royal house of Ala Mhigo. The professor then appends that members of the two sects once faced one another in single combat to open all fourteen chakra. Widargelt cannot understand why the sect of shadow insists on fighting rather than cooperating. In order to find the answer, he declares his intent to confront D'zentsa and O'tchakha once more. In the meantime, focus on mastering the new power that has been unleashed inside you.

※The next monk quest will be available from Widargelt upon reaching level 56.
objectives: Speak with Widargelt south of Dalamud's Talons.
Speak with Widargelt at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forename! A letter has arrived. It comes from D'zentsa and O'tchakha.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: They would speak with us. They bid us come to Dalamud's Talons.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: What their agenda is, I know not. But I would ask them questions of my own.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Professor Erik also sends word. He has learned of the sect of shadow. Soon, he will come to share his knowledge. But before I see him, I would see my former pupils.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I wish to believe in them. They are good at heart. Of this I am certain. Come, sisterbrother. We go to Dalamud's Talons.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: It has been a while. You two look well.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Thanks for coming. For what it's worth, we're sorry that we deceived you.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Know that it is for the benefit of both our sects that we fight.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: The other day, when you fended off our fellow disciples of shadow, a new chakra opened within you, did it not? Yet the sensation was unlike aught you had felt before.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: It's because you opened a chakra belonging to our aspect─the aspect of shadow. The opposite also applies, of course. Fighting a disciple of your sect allows us to open chakra belonging to the aspect of light.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Aspects of light and shadow? If this is the way of it, then why must we fight? Why can we not cooperate?

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Our master forbids it, I'm afraid. Our true master, that is.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: If truth be told, we shouldn't even be speaking with you. We are not permitted to exchange words─only blows.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: They leave us no choice. Come, sisterbrother! We will give them the exchange they desire!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: <gasp> Ahhh, my chakra has opened... <pant> 'Tis precisely as Master described...

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: <pant> Yesss, I feel the power surging through me... But if we're to become stronger─if we're to open any more chakra─we must throw ourselves into far fiercer struggles.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: The kind where lives are on the line.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: So long as you are disciples of light, we will continue to come for you, over and over. It cannot end until one side falls, never to rise again.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: And that's the reason we called you here.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: We don't want to hurt you.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: So please, give up being a monk. Give up any notion of rebuilding the Fist of Rhalgr. And go somewhere far, far away!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Wait!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: They would have me stop being a monk. Same as telling me to stop breathing.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Many revelations have there been this day. The existence of opposing aspects of chakra. This not the least of all. We must learn more of it.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The professor will soon arrive at Revenant's Toll. Perhaps he can enlighten us.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Strong backs and feeble minds as far as the eye can see... Yes, this is indeed the frontier.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming, Professor. The information I requested. Were you able to find it?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: (-Erik-)Of course I was, you incurable dolt! Elsewise I wouldn't have bothered to come all the way to this backwater! Now then, I have many demands on my time, so I shall convey my findings to you at once, and in the most concise manner possible. Ahem!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Now, it is common knowledge that the Fist of Rhalgr rose to the zenith of its power by virtue of royal endorsement. Lesser known is the dispute which broke out over this arrangement between two factions within the Fist─the sect of light and the sect of shadow.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: The head priest of the sect of light believed that an alliance with the royal house of Ala Mhigo was the key to prosperity. However, his counterpart in the sect of shadow disagreed, warning that it would lead to their undoing. History has proven them both right. But I digress.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Unsurprisingly, the disciples of each sect rallied to their respective leader's side, and the two factions clashed with words and fists both. In the end, the sect of light prevailed, the alliance with the royal house was sealed, and all members of the sect of shadow were banished from the order.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text:
So, in the past, the two sects both belonged to the Fist of Rhalgr, and their disciples trained beside one another as comrades. And yet, though the techniques they employed were identical, the manner in which they harnessed energy was opposed in nature.
It was this difference which gave rise to two aspects of chakra.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: There is a tradition wherein monks from the two schools would meet each other in single combat. In attacking you, I posit that the disciples of shadow are seeking to recreate this tradition.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: This clashing of light and shadow quickened the aether within, causing a chakra of the opposing aspect to open within them. In simple terms for your simple minds, disciples of light fought to open shadow chakra, and disciples of shadow fought to open light chakra.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: And the implications of this? There are not seven, but fourteen chakra all told. Yes, yes, two sides of the same coin; where there is light, there is shadow, and all that poetic tripe.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: One thing I do not understand, Professor. Why can our sects not cooperate? Why must the disciples of shadow attack like common brigands?

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: A feud caused the rift between the two sects─who's to say there isn't a feud still? I suspect only a member of the sect of shadow can tell you the truth. But now I must be off. I shall inquire further into the matter in my spare time. If there is aught else, you know where to find me.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We must speak with D'zentsa and O'tchakha again. I will try to track them down. Meanwhile, please continue honing your skills.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Why? Why must we fight?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Enough talk. We have no use for your words.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: We're just limbering up!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Try this on for size!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Steel yourselves for more!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: There's more where that came from!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Our own technique!? Stand clear, Forename!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: N-No... We aren't supposed to lose...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Bugger me... They're too strong...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Ugh... Forgive me, sisterbrother...
